item.description: Follow up from Vancouver DWeb Social Thanks everyone for coming to the first DWebYVR Social at The Permanent.
Follow up from DWebYVR “Flash Talks and Tea” event on Feb 15 Thanks so much folks for coming out for Flash Talks & Tea at The Permanent.
Follow up from (Insert Event Name) Thanks everyone for coming to the (insert event description) at (location e.g. The Permanent).

item.title: About
item.description: Connecting people, projects and protocols to build a decentralized web The DWeb Community https://getdweb.net/ is an initiative guided by the [[Internet Archive]].

item.title: AT Protocol
item.description: Authenticated Transfer Protocol is a decentralized social network protocol behind [[Bluesky]]. The Authenticated Transfer Protocol, aka atproto, is a federated protocol for large-scale distributed social applications.

item.title: Bluesky
item.description: The organization behind the [[AT Protocol]] decentralized social network stack. Bluesky Organization Website Bluesky Server - currently in private beta1 Ask in the [[Contact#Communication Channels|Signal group chat]] if you need an invite ↩︎

item.title: Boris Mann
item.description: Boris Mann is the founder of Fission, building an edge computing stack that includes identity, data, and compute on top of [[IPFS]] and other DWeb technologies.

item.title: Calendar
item.description: We use [[Luma]] to manage a shared collaborative calendar for DWeb events in Vancouver. The direct link to the calendar is https://lu.

item.title: Cascadia Collaborative Design
item.description: Cascadia Collaborative Design is a design, technology and business consulting firm dedicated to supporting collaborative communities – coworking, coliving, artists and maker spaces – with the tools they need to be healthy and successful.

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: Events and shared communication channels of the DWeb YVR node are covered by the DWeb Code of Conduct. We’ve included it directly below, with clarifications and specific info for the Vancouver node.

item.title: Colophon
item.description: Current Site Implemented by [[Jacky Zhao]] on Feb 11th, 2023. This is a Hugo powered website, built using [[Quartz]] and designed to be managed with [[Obsidian]].

item.title: Contact
item.description: There are lots of places to find us and get involved! Communication Channels [[Signal]] general group chat Subscribe by email to the [[Calendar]] https://lu.

item.title: Conveners
item.description: Conveners is what we call the organizers who bring people, events, and shared infrastructure together. [[Emily McGill]] [[Boris Mann]] How to get involved Use the [[Contact]] page to get in touch, introduce yourself at a live event, and/or come to a monthly planning event.

item.title: Coworking BC
item.description: Coworking BC is a society of independent, community-driven workspaces located around the province of BC. Each space is unique and independently operated, but we all share a mission of fostering collaboration and innovation in the workplace.

item.title: Dark Matter Labs
item.description: Dark Matter Labs works with partners, clients, and collaborators across the world, researching and developing new institutional support frameworks for collaborative system change.

item.title: Decentralized Web
item.description: This term, along with its shorthand DWeb, generally refers to efforts to keep the web open and not under centralized, private corporate control.

item.title: Digital Garden
item.description: A Digital Garden or Second Brain is an interconnected set of notes that show how information and concepts are connected to each other.

item.title: Digital Garden Jekyll Template
item.description: The original version of this site used this Jekyll Digital Garden template https://github.com/maximevaillancourt/digital-garden-jekyll-template The text below is part of the README for the project.

item.title: DWeb Principles
item.description: Copied from the DWeb Community site https://getdweb.net/principles 01. Technology for Human Agency We stand for technology that enables the primacy of people as beneficiaries of the technology, by upholding their security, privacy and self-determination.

item.title: DWeb YYZ Toronto
item.description: [[Boris Mann]] kicked off a DWeb Toronto event on Feb 16th, 2023, at Halo Brewery. Hopefully the Toronto community will get fully kicked off with a web presence, in the mean time here is the Signal group if you are interested in helping to convening more DWeb activity in Toronto.

item.title: DWebYVR Github
item.description: We have a Github organization at https://github.com/DWebYVR The notes repo is where the source code for this website is available. The [[Colophon]] details how the website is built.

item.title: Emily McGill
item.description: Emily McGill is a co-founder and Director at Living Systems Network, fostering principles and practices for a more regenerative culture. A [[multipotentialite]], Emily brings her convening superpower to catalyze community collaboration in the distributed web space (with a strong affinity towards Holochain.

item.title: Feb 2023 Flash Talks & Tea
item.description: ​Come catalyze the Vancouver DWeb node! Join us for an evening of socializing and networking with other digital creators and technologists in Vancouver.

item.title: Holochain
item.description: Holochain is a post-blockchain decentralized platform for distributed applications People in Vancouver associated with the protocol: [[Emily McGill]] [[Wesley Finck]]

item.title: How to Contribute
item.description: We see the DWeb YVR community as a platform to connect with others who share interest in [[DWeb Principles]]. Example Contributions Some examples of ways to take action:

item.title: Infrastructure
item.description: An outline of the various tools and systems and who has permission and access. Github We have a DWebYVR github org.

item.title: Jacky Zhao
item.description: Creator of [[Quartz]] and implemented this [[Colophon|version of the website]].

item.title: multipotentialite
item.description: A multipotentialite is an individual whose interests and skills span multiple fields or areas, rather than being strong in just one.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: Obsidian is a [[Digital Garden]] tool. #todo [[Using Obsidian to work on the DWebYVR website]]

item.title: Open Collective
item.description: Open Collective is: a legal and financial toolbox for grassroots groups. It’s a fundraising + legal status + money management platform for your community.

item.title: Organizations
item.description: A list of organizations, projects, and protocols that support [[DWeb Principles]] and/or have regional ties to Vancouver [[Internet Archive Canada]] / [[The Permanent]] [[Fission]] [[Living Systems Network]] [[Holochain]] [[Solana]] [[DCTRL]] [[Tomo Spaces]] [[Dark Matter Labs]] [[Red Gate Arts Society]] [[Cascadia Collaborative Design]] [[Coworking BC]] Feel free to list People as well on your Organization page.

item.title: Protocols
item.description: Open protocols, standards, and specifications relevant to the DWeb. [[Holochain]] [[Solana]] [[IPFS]] [[AT Protocol]] [[ActivityPub]] Resources Protocols, Not Platforms: A Technological Approach to Free Speech, Mike Masnick, August 2019

item.title: Quartz
item.description: A Hugo-powered digital garden framework created by [[Jacky Zhao]] https://quartz.jzhao.xyz/ Extremely fast natural-language search Customizable and hackable design based on Hugo Automatically generated [[backlinks]], link previews, and local graph Built-in CJK + Latex Support and Admonition-style callouts Support for both Markdown Links and [[wikilinks]] It is [[Obsidian]] compatible, or can be edited directly through Github with basic Markdown skills.

item.title: Red Gate Arts Society
item.description: Not for Profit DIY Music and Art Space Red Gate TV Youtube @redgateartssociety Red Gate TV Broadcast schedule Mastodon Server Red gate operates a [[Mastodon]] server at https://redgate.

item.title: Solana
item.description: Solana Labs, Solana Foundation, and Solana Mobile build infrastructure, products, protocols, and devices for the Solana network – a high-performance, low-cost, efficient, and decentralized blockchain.

item.title: Steven Luscher
item.description: Steven Luscher is a JavaScript infrastructure developer who works at [[Solana]]. He maintains the @solana/web3.js library for building web3 applications in JavaScript.

item.title: The Permanent
item.description: The physical headquarters of [[Internet Archive Canada]]. 330 West Pender Street in Downtown Vancouver, just a block from the DCTRL hackerspace.

item.title: Tomo Spaces
item.description: Tomo Spaces is a real estate company building at the intersection of “hardwhere” and “softwhere,” where physical space and intangible activities meet.

item.title: Using Luma to Run Events
item.description: Luma is a simple event organizing and registration tool. We use it for events, as well as to manage the collaborative [[calendar|DWeb YVR Calendar]].

item.title: Vancouver DWeb Hackathon July 2023
item.description: Planning thread https://github.com/orgs/DWebYVR/discussions/30 What: A one day weekend hackathon to bring together people working on a variety of DWeb protocols. Code together, learn together in a shared space, and learn about each others projects and progress.

item.title: Vancouver DWeb Social, January 2023
item.description: Original event registration. Did you know that the Internet Archive now has a Canadian edition? And that they have an amazing space in downtown Vancouver that supports everything from servers to socials?

item.title: Wesley Finck
item.description: Wesley is a Holochain App Developer working to help bring into existence a more humane internet. A few of his interests include:
